conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves to the right and directly above the objects.

Shadow A is cast from the brown spherical object (likely an egg). It is elongated and positioned to the left of the object.
Shadow B is cast from the blue cylindrical object. It is elongated and positioned to the left of the object.
Shadow C is cast from the black intricate object (possibly a sculpture or model with curved features). It is elongated and positioned to the left of the object.
Shadow D is cast from the rectangular object with a red top and white label (likely a cigarette pack). It is elongated and positioned to the left of the object.

conclusion: The shadows will no longer be elongated towards the left but will shrink and become more compact under the objects.
